update.description:
I've added a test for the message-passing interface used by the GUI move tool. I also threw in a test for setting the gravity value via the message passing interface.

I'm open to suggestions for the name of the test file. It's currently called `test/regression/gui_test.cc`.
update.title: Added test for GUI move tool

pullrequest.title: Added test for GUI move tool

content.raw: In addition to changing the test name to physics_msgs, I updated to use the `INSTANTIATE_PHYSICS_ENGINES_TEST` macro. I also did some more thorough testing and switched to a while loop instead of fixed wait periods. The `make test` timeout should prevent hangs.
content.html: In addition to changing the test name to physics_msgs, I updated to use the INSTANTIATE_PHYSICS_ENGINES_TEST macro. I also did some more thorough testing and switched to a while loop instead of fixed wait periods. The make test timeout should prevent hangs.

content.html:
The else should resullt in a NULL value and we are checking that model is TRUE? Double check on the same.

Maybe we can change the code flow a bit and remove totally the if/else and write something like:

physics::ModelPtr model = world->GetModel(name);
ASSERT_TRUE(model) << "Could not get pointer to " << name << std::endl;

math::Pose initialPose = model->GetWorldPose();
EXPECT_EQ(pos, initialPose.pos);

msgs::Model msg;
...
